qmt.geometry.geo_data module¶

class qmt.geometry.geo_data.Geo1DData[source]¶

Bases: qmt.task_framework.data_template.Data

add_part(part_name, start_point, end_point, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Add a part to this geometry. :param str part_name: Name of the part to create :param float start_point: Position of the start of the part :param float end_point: Position of the end of the part :param bool overwrite: Should we allow this to overwrite?

remove_part(part_name, ignore_if_absent=False)[source]¶

Remove a part from this geometry. :param str part_name: Name of part to remove :param bool ignore_if_absent: Should we ignore an attempted removal if the part name is not found?

class qmt.geometry.geo_data.Geo2DData[source]¶

Bases: qmt.task_framework.data_template.Data

add_part(part_name, part, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Add a part to this geometry. :param str part_name: Name of the part to create :param Polygon part: Polygon object from shapely.geometry. This must be a valid Polygon. :param bool overwrite: Should we allow this to overwrite?

remove_part(part_name, ignore_if_absent=False)[source]¶

Remove a part from this geometry. :param str part_name: Name of part to remove :param bool ignore_if_absent: Should we ignore an attempted removal if the part name is not found?

add_edge(edge_name, edge, overwrite=False)[source]¶

Add an edge to this geometry. :param str edge_name: Name of the edge to create :param LineString edge: LineString object from shapely.geometry. :param bool overwrite: Should we allow this to overwrite?

Remove an edge from this geometry. :param str edge_name: Name of part to remove :param bool ignore_if_absent: Should we ignore an attempted removal if the part name is not found?

qmt.geometry.property_map module¶

class qmt.geometry.property_map.PropertyMap[source]¶

Bases: object

Map points in the simulation domain to properties of parts containing the points.

Parameters:
  • part_map (PartMap) – Mapper from spatial location to part identifier.
  • prop_map (callable) – Map from part identifier to a property value.
get_part(x)[source]¶

Find the part(s) containing one or more points.

Parameters:x – Coordinate vector or array of coordinate vectors.
Returns:Part identifier (if x is a single coordinate vector); or array of part identifiers, of the same shape as x except for the last axis corresponding to coordinate vector extent.
class qmt.geometry.property_map.MaterialPropertyMap(part_map, part_materials, mat_lib, prop_name, eunit=None, fill_value='raise')[source]¶

Bases: qmt.geometry.property_map.PropertyMap

Map points in the simulation domain to material properties of parts containing the points.

Parameters:
  • part_map (PartMap) – Mapper from spatial location to part identifier.
  • part_materials (dict) – Dict mapping from part identifier to a material name.
  • mat_lib (Materials) – Materials library used to look up the material properties.
  • prop_name (str) – Name of the material property to be retrieved for each part.
  • eunit – Energy unit, passed to mat_lib.find().
  • fill_value – Value to be filled in places where there is no part or the part does not have a material or the material does not have the property prop_name. The default behavior fill_value=’raise’ is to raise a KeyError in these cases.

Geometry generation and handling.
